title: La Peg to debut Pegsicle, an ice bar, in Old City this week
text:
La Peg to debut Pegsicle, an ice bar, in Old City this week Updated: January 31, 2017 — 3:56 PM EST 346 Share 
Nick Vadala writes about food and entertainment for Philly.com. More by Nick Vadala Arrow icon 
This week, nights at La Peg in Old City will get a little cooler — and more tipsy — with the debut of Pegsicle, a temporary ice bar. 
Pegsicle debuts Wednesday, Feb. 1 at La Peg (at the foot of Race Street at Columbus Boulevard), and will be in place through Feb. 13, providing it doesn’t melt before then. La Peg chef-owner Peter Woolsey, whom a release calls an "amateur ice carver," will carve the bar out of 16 blocks of ice using Japanese ice chisels and chainsaws. 
In addition to carving the bar, which will include a shot luge, Woolsey also designed it in a hand-drawn sketch: La Peg Handout A hand-drawn sketch shows Pegsicle, which comes to La Peg on Wednesday, Feb. 1. 
The ice bar will be located in La Peg’s Haas Biergarten, which features fire pits to keep folks from getting too cold. Pegsicle also will be open for La Peg’s Big Game Hot Chicken Pop-Up event on Sunday, Feb. 5. 
The outdoor bar will have drinks available, including mulled wine and alcoholic hot cocoa, and craft beer from breweries including Sly Fox, Oskar Blues, and others. The menu is as follows: 
Hot Drinks ($7): 
Spiked hot chocolate (choice of Kahlua, peppermint schnapps, or tequila) 
Cocktails ($7): 
Rum daiquiri (white rum, lime, sugar) Moscow Mule (vodka, ginger beer, lime, bitters) Celery Tonic (gin, celery juice, tonic, lemon) 
Canned beers and ciders ($5): 
Sly Fox 113 IPA Oskar Blues Old Chub Scotch Ale Blackbird Cider Works Apple Cider
